disease.name: Disease
disease.description: A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant that produces specific symptoms or affects a specific location.

neurodegenerative_disease.name: Neurodegenerative Disease
neurodegenerative_disease.description: Diseases characterized by progressive degeneration of the structure and function of the central nervous system or peripheral nervous system.

als.name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
als.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.

alzheimers.name: Alzheimer's Disease
alzheimers.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that leads to brain cell death and is the most common cause of dementia.

parkinsons.name: Parkinson's Disease
parkinsons.description: A progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement and often includes tremors.

protein.name: Protein
protein.description: Macromolecules consisting of chains of amino acids that perform a vast array of functions within organisms.

tau_protein.name: Tau Protein
tau_protein.description: A protein that stabilizes microtubules in neurons, and which can form neurofibrillary tangles in Alzheimer's disease.

amyloid_beta.name: Amyloid Beta
amyloid_beta.description: A peptide that is the main component of amyloid plaques found in the brains of Alzheimer's patients.

oxidative_stress.name: Oxidative Stress
oxidative_stress.description: An imbalance between the production of free radicals and the ability of the body to counteract their harmful effects through neutralization by antioxidants.

mitochondrial_dysfunction.name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction
mitochondrial_dysfunction.description: Abnormalities in the function of mitochondria, which are responsible for producing energy for cells.

neuroinflammation.name: Neuroinflammation
neuroinflammation.description: Inflammation of nervous tissue, which can be triggered by various stimuli including infection, trauma, and toxins.

gene.name: Gene
gene.description: A sequence of nucleotides in DNA or RNA that codes for a molecule that has a function.

sod1.name: SOD1
sod1.description: A gene that provides instructions for making the enzyme superoxide dismutase, which breaks down superoxide radicals. Mutations in SOD1 are a cause of familial ALS.

c9orf72.name: C9orf72
c9orf72.description: A gene that, when mutated with a hexanucleotide repeat expansion, is a major cause of both ALS and frontotemporal dementia.

treatment.name: Treatment
treatment.description: Medical care given to a patient for an illness or injury.

drug.name: Drug
drug.description: A substance used to prevent or cure a disease or to alleviate symptoms.

riluzole.name: Riluzole
riluzole.description: A drug used to treat ALS, believed to work by reducing glutamate toxicity.

edaravone.name: Edaravone
edaravone.description: A drug used to treat ALS, acting as a free radical scavenger to prevent oxidative stress.

cellular_process.name: Cellular Process
cellular_process.description: A process that is carried out at the cellular level, but not necessarily restricted to a single cell.

apoptosis.name: Apoptosis
apoptosis.description: A form of programmed cell death that occurs in multicellular organisms.

autophagy.name: Autophagy
autophagy.description: A cellular process that involves the degradation and recycling of cellular components.

protein_misfolding.name: Protein Misfolding
protein_misfolding.description: A process where proteins fold into an incorrect three-dimensional structure, which can lead to aggregation and disease.
